title: Tesla, Bitcoin, Palantir, GameStop: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
sub_head: Recent strong earnings reports and hopes for new stimulus are lifting investors’ spirits
body:
—U.S. stock futures advanced, along with bond yields and oil prices, as investors wagered that a new round of stimulus spending would bolster the economy.
—Futures tied to the S&P 500 ticked up 0.4% after the benchmark stocks gauge posted its biggest one-week advance since November and closed Friday at an all-time high. Futures for the technology-heavy Nasdaq-100 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average added 0.5%. Read our full market wrap here.
—Earnings are due from Simon Property Group , Take-Two Interactive Software and KKR after the close.
—Tesla shares gained 2.2% premarket after it disclosed that it bought $1.5 billion worth of bitcoin. It also said it expects to begin accepting the cryptocurrency as a form of payment. The price of bitcoin itself jumped nearly 13%.
—The iCar may have to wait.  Apple ‘s talks with Hyundai Motor Group have failed to lead to an agreement for the South Korean auto giant to assemble vehicles for the iPhone company. Apple’s shares nudged up 0.1% ahead of the bell.
